question: It is better for the younger people to get advice from the older ones. Do you agree ir disagree?
text: It is truly believed, that older people are prone to give reasonable advices for the younger generations, according to their higher levels of expertise. In my opinion, it must be a great idea, unless it does not limit or block some interesting thoughts coming from a juvenile perspective. In this essay, I am going to be discreet regarding my agreements and disagreements with this assertion.

At the onset, it is true, that older people may provide for a few relevant tips, as their life experience is supposed to be diverse. They may give you some free consultations about your future career and newborn aspirations. For example, I asked for a help myself a few times, given my poor achievements in job search. I have been dreaming of interning at Procter & Gamble for a long time; therefore, I inquired a LinkedIn acquaintance regarding any possibilities. As a result, I lost a chance to stand out, but I learned a lesson thanks to my useful connection.

Apart from the statement above, a handful of certain advices does sound extremely outdated. Unluckily, not everyone tends to keep the pace with the hottest trends. For instance, once again, I was recommended to try out B2B marketing as a general specialization area. Consequently, my curiosity led me to the Internet research, by the end of which I quickly realised - that method was replaced with digital advertising three years ago. Having said that, I would like to stress the attention on looking for particular answers on your own, as the older people's knowledge and values might be irrelevant.
In a nutshell, the adults can be immensely resourceful at some point; although, their life perspectives and background history do not always mean the accuracy.
